availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Payne (Union County, Kentucky, farmer, student, and provisional government convention member)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer, student, and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Son of George B. Payne and Julia Ann Payne. Married to Amelia Payne. Farmer and student in Union County in 1850. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville, Kentucky, in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 479B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 3 of 19 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 328.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. 145B.
Confederate Papers Relating to Citizens or Business Firms, compiled 1874-1889, documenting the period 1861-1865. NARA RG 109, Publication M346, Roll 0782.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
